jpo
Class ThumbnailJScrollPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JScrollPane
                  jpo.ThumbnailJScrollPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener
public class ThumbnailJScrollPane
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane
implements javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

The ThumbnailJScrollPane manages a JPanel in a JScrollPane that displays a group of pictures in a grid of thumbnails or ad hoc search results.. Real pictures are shown as a thumbnail of the image whilst sub-groups are shown as a folder icon. Each thumbnail has it's caption under the image.

If the size of the component is changed the images are re-laid out and can take advantage of the extra space if there is some.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

ThumbnailPane

public javax.swing.JPanel ThumbnailPane
the JPanel that is placed inside the JScrollPane which holds the title and the ThumbnailComponents

title

private javax.swing.JLabel title
the JLabel that holds the description of the group being shown.

tl

private ThumbnailJScrollPane.ThumbnailLoaderThread tl
A Thread that will load the images.

stopThread

public boolean stopThread
variable that will signal to the thread to stop loading images.

ThumbnailLayout

public java.awt.GridBagLayout ThumbnailLayout
the layout object that handles all layouting in the ThumbnailPane

thumbnailConstraints

private java.awt.GridBagConstraints thumbnailConstraints
a GridBagConstraints object to position the Thumbnails on the panel;

descriptionConstraints

private java.awt.GridBagConstraints descriptionConstraints
a GridBagConstraints object to position theDescriptions on the panel;

currentGroupNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode currentGroupNode
This variable holds the node of the group whose pictures and subgroups are being shown.

cols

private int cols
the number of columns that are being displayed in the pane. When the pane is resized the ComponentListener fires off code with repositions the thumbnails if the number of columns has changed.

startIndex

private int startIndex
a variable to hold the current starting position of thumbnails being displayed out of a group or search.

This was invented to allow the number of thumbnails to be restricted so that <> errors may be averted on long lists of pictures.

nextThumbnailsButton

private javax.swing.JButton nextThumbnailsButton
a button that is added when there are more than the maximum number of thumbnails to be shown for a search or a group.

previousThumbnailsButton

private javax.swing.JButton previousThumbnailsButton
a button that is added when the first thumbnails being shown is not the first of the group or search. Essentially this is controlled by the startIndex variable.

See Also:
startIndex

rootNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode rootNode
A reference to the root node of the tree. This allows the Thumbnail pane to communicate with the data model and receive notifactions from it.

thumbnails

private Thumbnail[] thumbnails
An array that holds the 50 or so ThumbnailComponents that are being displayed

thumbnailDescriptionJPanels

private ThumbnailDescriptionJPanel[] thumbnailDescriptionJPanels
An array that holds the 50 or so ThumbnailDescriptionJPanels that are being displayed

horizontalPadding

private static final int horizontalPadding
The amount of horizontal padding between the thumbnails and descriptions.

The amount of vertical padding between the thumbnails and descriptions.

Constructor Detail

ThumbnailJScrollPane

public ThumbnailJScrollPane(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode rootNode)
creates a new JScrollPane with an embedded JPanel and provides a set of methods that allow thumbnails to be displayed.

The passing in of the caller is obsolete and should be removed when a better interface type solution has been built.

Method Detail

requestShowGroup

public void requestShowGroup(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode showNode)
calls showGroup but also makes sure the JTree positions itself on the selected group.

Parameters:
showNode - The GroupNode to be displayed.
See Also:
showGroup(jpo.SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode)

showGroup

public void showGroup(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode showNode)
forces the specified group to be displayed.

Parameters:
showNode - The GroupNode to be displayed.
See Also:
requestShowGroup(jpo.SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode)

layoutThumbnails

private void layoutThumbnails()
this method runs through all the thumbnails on the panel and makes sure they are set to the correct node. It also sets the tile of the JScrollPane.

layoutThumbnailsInThread

private void layoutThumbnailsInThread()
This method fires off a Thread that lays out the Thumbnails on the Pane.

whichNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode whichNode(int componentNumber)
this method returns the SDMTN node for the position on the panel (0..maxThumbnails). If there are more Thumbnails than nodes in the group it returns null.

Parameters:
componentNumber - The component 0..n which should be translated into the proper node

setAssociatedCleverJTree

public void setAssociatedCleverJTree(CleverJTree associatedCleverJTree)
sets the assoiciated JTree

sets the assoiciated InfoPanel

getAssociatedCleverJTree

public CleverJTree getAssociatedCleverJTree()
returns the associated JTree

getAssociatedInfoPanel

public InfoPanel getAssociatedInfoPanel()
returns the associated InfoPanel

treeNodesChanged

public void treeNodesChanged(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
This method is defined by the TreeModelListener interface and gives the JThumnailScrollPane a notification that some nodes changed in a non dramatic way. The nodes that were changed have their Constraints reevaluated and a revalidate is called to update the screen.

Specified by:
treeNodesChanged in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

treeNodesInserted

public void treeNodesInserted(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
This method is defined by the TreeModelListener interface and gives the JThumnailScrollPane a notification if additional nodes were inserted. The additional nodes are added and the existing nodes are reevaluated as to whether they are at the right place. Revalidate is called to update the screen.

Specified by:
treeNodesInserted in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

treeNodesRemoved

public void treeNodesRemoved(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
This method is defined by the TreeModelListener interface and gives the JThumnailScrollPane a notification that some nodes were removed. It steps through all the Thumbnail Components and makes sure they all are at the correct location. The dead ones are removed.

Specified by:
treeNodesRemoved in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

treeStructureChanged

public void treeStructureChanged(javax.swing.event.TreeModelEvent e)
This method is defined by the TreeModelListener interface and gives the JThumnailScrollPane a notification if there was a massive structure change in the tree. In this event all laying out shall stop and the group should be laid out from scratch.

Specified by:
treeStructureChanged in interface javax.swing.event.TreeModelListener

getCols

public int getCols()
tells how many colums we have on the panel;

setCols

public void setCols(int cols)
sets the number of colums we have on the panel;

calculateCols

public boolean calculateCols()
calculates the number of colums we have on the panel;

Returns:
true if the number of columns changed, false if not changed

calculateConstraints

private void calculateConstraints(int position)
this method returns a GridBagContraint object which has the x and y of the component in the panel. This depends on the position and the number of columns

killThread

public void killThread()
method that requests the thread to die nicely and waits 300ms for it to complete. It is stopped nicely by setting the variable stopThread to true. The loop checks this variable every time round and aborts cleanly if this is set. The variable is set to false when the method exits.

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String titleString)
changes the title at the top of the page

Parameters:
titleString - The text to be printed across the top of all columns. Usually this will be the name of the group

setButtonVisibility

public void setButtonVisibility()
This method sets whether the previous and next buttons are visible or not
